fi.aalto.skillserver.tcpio

Class SkillBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • fi.aalto.skillserver.tcpio.SkillBridge
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SkillBridge
extends java.lang.Thread
    SkillBridge The Java part of the bridge between NXT and Java. Takes care of all communication between the two and ensures the skill is synchronised to the implementation running in NXT.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • SkillBridge

        public SkillBridge(java.net.Socket socket,
                   SkillNodeManager nodemanager)
        Initialises this bridge instance.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket the NXT implementation connected to.
        nodemanager - Nodemanager instance managing the skills.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Main function that is run when the bridge thread starts. Handles the communication to and from the NXT side.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • callReturn

        private void callReturn(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String callType,
                        java.lang.String callResult)
        Handles the response data from NXT after a method has been called. The call fails if remote control is not enabled in the NXT app.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the skill that sent the data.
        callType - The method that this response belongs to.
        callResult - The result of the method call.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to NXT and deletes the corresponding skill from the address space.

      • initSkill

        private boolean initSkill(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String type)
        Creates the skill in the address space with the specified name and type. Also renames the thread for easier recognition.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the skill to create.
        type - Type of the skill to create. (Basic(Sens) or Composed(Sens))
        Returns:
        True if skill was created successfully.

      • updateSkill

        private boolean updateSkill(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String CurrentState,
                            java.lang.String LastTransition,
                            java.lang.String ReturnData)
        Updates the state and last transition of the skill. Also triggers a transition event to notify about the state change. If the skill is a sensor, also updates the return data.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the skill that sent the data.
        CurrentState - The new state of the skill state machine.
        LastTransition - The transition that just occurred.
        ReturnData - The return data from sensor.
        Returns:
        True if the skill was updated successfully.

      • setStartParam

        public void setStartParam(java.lang.String param)
        Set the start parameter (when calling the UA Method).
        Parameters:
        param - The start parameter to send together with the start call.

      • sendStart

        public void sendStart()
               throws com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException
        Sends the start command to NXT. Runs when the UA method with same name is called.
        Throws:
        com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException

      • sendStop

        public void sendStop()
              throws com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException
        Sends the stop command to NXT. Runs when the UA method with same name is called.
        Throws:
        com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException

      • sendReset

        public void sendReset()
               throws com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException

        Throws:
        com.prosysopc.ua.StatusException

        public void sendLock()
